What is the term overfitting mean in the context of Supervised Learning?
column3:
Overfitting is a scenario where a machine learning model learns the training data too closely. It captures even the noise and outliers in the training data and it has a high bias towards the training dataset.

It can sometimes happen when we use complex polynomial functions to fit the training data so accurately that it becomes so specific that it cannot give good results when new unseen data is used.

Techniques to reduce overfitting include increasing training data and reducing model complexity.
